edu.lehigh.cse.lol

Class Display

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.lehigh.cse.lol.Display

  • public class Display
extends java.lang.Object
    LOL Games have a heads-up display (hud). The hud is a place for displaying text and drawing touchable buttons, so that as the hero moves through the level, the buttons and text can remain at the same place on the screen. This class encapsulates all of the displayable text.

    • Method Detail

      • addCountdown

        public static Display addCountdown(float timeout,
                                   java.lang.String text,
                                   int x,
                                   int y)
        Add a countdown timer to the screen. When time is up, the level ends in defeat
        Parameters:
        timeout - Starting value of the timer
        text - The text to display when the timer expires
        x - The X coordinate of the bottom left corner (in pixels)
        y - The Y coordinate of the bottom left corner (in pixels)

      • addCountdown

        public static Display addCountdown(float timeout,
                                   java.lang.String text,
                                   int x,
                                   int y,
                                   java.lang.String fontName,
                                   int red,
                                   int green,
                                   int blue,
                                   int size)
        Add a countdown timer to the screen, with extra features for describing the appearance of the font. When time is up, the level ends in defeat.
        Parameters:
        timeout - Starting value of the timer
        text - The text to display when the timer expires
        x - The X coordinate of the bottom left corner (in pixels)
        y - The Y coordinate of the bottom left corner (in pixels)
        fontName - The name of the font file to use
        red - The red portion of text color (0-255)
        green - The green portion of text color (0-255)
        blue - The blue portion of text color (0-255)
        size - The font size to use (20 is usually a good value)

      • addFPS

        public static Display addFPS(int x,
                             int y,
                             java.lang.String fontName,
                             int red,
                             int green,
                             int blue,
                             int size)
        Print the frames per second. We use this in debug mode, but some people like to show it all the time.
        Parameters:
        x - The X coordinate of the bottom left corner (in pixels)
        y - The Y coordinate of the bottom left corner (in pixels)
        fontName - The name of the font file to use
        red - The red portion of text color (0-255)
        green - The green portion of text color (0-255)
        blue - The blue portion of text color (0-255)
        size - The font size to use (20 is usually a good value)

      • addGoodieCount

        public static Display addGoodieCount(int type,
                                     int max,
                                     java.lang.String text,
                                     int x,
                                     int y,
                                     java.lang.String fontName,
                                     int red,
                                     int green,
                                     int blue,
                                     int size)
        Add a count of the current number of goodies of the specified type, with extra features for describing the appearance of the font
        Parameters:
        type - The type of goodie to show (1-4)
        max - If this is > 0, then the message wil be of the form XX/max instead of just XX
        text - The text to display after the number of goodies
        x - The X coordinate of the bottom left corner (in pixels)
        y - The Y coordinate of the bottom left corner (in pixels)
        fontName - The name of the font file to use
        red - The red portion of text color (0-255)
        green - The green portion of text color (0-255)
        blue - The blue portion of text color (0-255)
        size - The font size to use (20 is usually a good value)

                                       int x,
                                       int y,
                                       Hero h)
        Display a strength meter for a specific hero
        Parameters:
        text - The text to display after the remaining strength value
        x - The X coordinate of the bottom left corner (in pixels)
        y - The Y coordinate of the bottom left corner (in pixels)
        h - The Hero whose strength should be displayed

      • addLevelFact

        public static Display addLevelFact(java.lang.String key,
                                   int x,
                                   int y,
                                   java.lang.String fontName,
                                   int red,
                                   int green,
                                   int blue,
                                   int size,
                                   java.lang.String prefix,
                                   java.lang.String suffix)
        Display text corresponding to a fact saved for the current level
        Parameters:
        key - The key to look up in the Fact store
        x - The X coordinate of the bottom left corner (in pixels)
        y - The Y coordinate of the bottom left corner (in pixels)
        fontName - The name of the font file to use
        red - The red portion of text color (0-255)
        green - The green portion of text color (0-255)
        blue - The blue portion of text color (0-255)
        size - The font size to use (20 is usually a good value)
        prefix - Text to put before the fact
        suffix - Text to put after the fact

      • addSessionFact

        public static Display addSessionFact(java.lang.String key,
                                     int x,
                                     int y,
                                     java.lang.String fontName,
                                     int red,
                                     int green,
                                     int blue,
                                     int size,
                                     java.lang.String prefix,
                                     java.lang.String suffix)
        Display text corresponding to a fact saved for the current game session
        Parameters:
        key - The key to look up in the Fact store
        x - The X coordinate of the bottom left corner (in pixels)
        y - The Y coordinate of the bottom left corner (in pixels)
        fontName - The name of the font file to use
        red - The red portion of text color (0-255)
        green - The green portion of text color (0-255)
        blue - The blue portion of text color (0-255)
        size - The font size to use (20 is usually a good value)
        prefix - Text to put before the fact
        suffix - Text to put after the fact
